# (PART\*) ANOVA {-}

# ANOVA: Oneway {#oneway-anova}  

##### How to perform an ANOVA in jamovi: {-}

1. You need one grouping variable one continuous outcome variable. Make sure that the grouping variable is marked with <img src="images/icons/nominal.JPG" width="3%" alt=" grouped data icon"/> and the continuous variable is marked with <img src="images/icons/continuous.JPG" width="3%" alt=" the continuous data icon"/> (see section \@ref(level-of-measurement)).  
A correct setup should look similar to this:  
<img src="images/data_format/data_format_anova.JPG" width="40%"/>  

2. Select `Analyses` -> `ANOVA` -> `ANOVA`.  
<img src="images/select/select_anova.JPG" width="45%"/> 

3. Drag and drop your outcome variable to __Dependent Variable__ and your grouping variable to __Fixed Factors__.  
<img src="images/add_var/add_var_anova.JPG" width="70%"/> 

4. The results is shown in the right pane:  
<img src="images/output/output_anova.JPG" width="70%"/>
